page.title: 17Country Roads, Randalstown
page.content: Situated at intervals along the middle of most 'B'and'C'class roads in the country are "cats eyes". These are a great help in guiding road users at night or in foggy conditions. These are made of two glass prisms, with an aluminium reflector at the back of each. This reflects the lights of on_coming traffic towards the motorist. When a car runs over a cat's eye it sinks down into a bed of rubber and the glass is cleaned on small ridges. (Invented 1934. Shaw) Cats Eyes have undoubtedly help save many lives over the years, but at present these are only installed on the main roads in this area. Surely something of this nature is needed on all roadways as it is usually the narrower more twisting country roads which are most dangerous.
